flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Materials Needed:

Steel:

  • .25x2 Flat: 12” (1) – Controller Mount
  • .25x3 Flat: 6”(1) Controller Mount Bottom Piece
  • .25x6 Flat: 12” (1) Valve Mount
  • .25x6 Flat: 15” (1) Controller Mount
  • .125x29x13.5 Sheet (1) Dirt Keeper Plate
  • .125x29x17.5 Sheet (1) Brick Holder Plate

Sketchup Model
guide.introduction_rendered:
Materials Needed:

Steel:

  • .25x2 Flat: 12” (1) – Controller Mount
  • .25x3 Flat: 6”(1) Controller Mount Bottom Piece
  • .25x6 Flat: 12” (1) Valve Mount
  • .25x6 Flat: 15” (1) Controller Mount
  • .125x29x13.5 Sheet (1) Dirt Keeper Plate
  • .125x29x17.5 Sheet (1) Brick Holder Plate

Sketchup Model

Tools
  • Drill press
  • Welder
  • hole puncher

lines.text: Punch all holes, or drill if necessary.
lines.text_raw: Punch all holes, or drill if necessary.

lines.text: Find your controller box and locate its mounting holes on the back.
lines.text_raw: Find your controller box and locate its mounting holes on the back.

lines.text: Place it on top of the 6x15 plate so it is square and the top hole is about ½” away from the top. Transfer punch the holes on the controller box to the plate.
lines.text_raw: Place it on top of the 6x15 plate so it is square and the top hole is about ½” away from the top. Transfer punch the holes on the controller box to the plate.

lines.text: You can drill them a little bigger (up to 5/16") if you'd like, as it's difficult to get the holes perfectly aligned.
lines.text_raw: You can drill them a little bigger (up to 5/16") if you'd like, as it's difficult to get the holes perfectly aligned.

lines.text: Punch the holes in the bottom piece.
lines.text_raw: Punch the holes in the bottom piece.

lines.text: Weld the bottom piece to the large plate.
lines.text_raw: Weld the bottom piece to the large plate.

lines.text: Weld the flatbar on the back.
lines.text_raw: Weld the flatbar on the back.

guide.title: CEB Simple Plates
